content: What 1970s Swedish pop group is best known for hits like "Dancing Queen" and "Mamma Mia"?

ABBA is the Swedish pop group from the 1970s that is best known for hits like "Dancing Queen" and "Mamma Mia." The group was formed in Stockholm in 1972 and consisted of Agnetha Fältskog, Björn Ulvaeus, Benny Andersson, and Anni-Frid Lyngstad. ABBA achieved massive international success in the 1970s and early 1980s, winning the Eurovision Song Contest in 1974 with their song "Waterloo." They are considered one of the most successful groups in the history of popular music, with an estimated 380 million records sold worldwide. Their music has been featured in various films, musicals, and television shows, and they continue to have a dedicated fan base to this day.
